SEARCH
Package com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graph

Interface Graph<V,E>

Type Parameters:
V - Type of element stored at a vertex
E - Type of element stored at an edge
All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Digraph<V,E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DigraphEdgeList, GraphEdgeList
public interface Graph<V,E> extends Serializable
A graph is made up of a set of vertices connected by edges, where the edges have no direction associated with them, i.e., they establish a two-way connection.
See Also:
  • Edge
  • Vertex

  • Method Details

    • numVertices

      int numVertices()
      Returns the total number of vertices of the graph.
      Returns:
      total number of vertices

    • numEdges

      int numEdges()
      Returns the total number of edges of the graph.
      Returns:
      total number of vertices

    • vertices

      Collection<Vertex<V>> vertices()
      Returns the vertices of the graph as a collection.
      If there are no vertices, returns an empty collection.
      Returns:
      collection of vertices

    • objectsInVertices

      Collection<V> objectsInVertices()
      Returns the objects stored in vertices of the graph as a collection.
      If there are no vertices, returns an empty collection.
      Returns:
      collection of objects from vertices

    • objectsInEdges

      Collection<E> objectsInEdges()
      Returns the objects stored in edges of the graph as a collection.
      If there are no edges, returns an empty collection.
      Returns:
      collection of objects from vertices

    • edges

      Collection<Edge<E,V>> edges()
      Returns the edges of the graph as a collection.
      If there are no edges, returns an empty collection.
      Returns:
      collection of edges

    • incidentEdges

      Collection<Edge<E,V>> incidentEdges(Vertex<V> v) throws InvalidVertexException
      Returns a vertex's incident edges as a collection.
      Incident edges are all edges that are connected to vertex v. If there are no incident edges, e.g., an isolated vertex, returns an empty collection.
      Parameters:
      v - vertex for which to obtain the incident edges
      Returns:
      collection of edges
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if the vertex is invalid for the graph

    • opposite

      Vertex<V> opposite(Vertex<V> v, Edge<E,V> e) throws InvalidVertexException, InvalidEdgeException
      Given vertex v, return the opposite vertex at the other end of edge e.
      If both v and e are valid, but e is not connected to v, returns null.
      Parameters:
      v - vertex on one end of e
      e - edge connected to v
      Returns:
      opposite vertex along e
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if the vertex is invalid for the graph
      InvalidEdgeException - if the edge is invalid for the graph

    • areAdjacent

      boolean areAdjacent(Vertex<V> u, Vertex<V> v) throws InvalidVertexException
      Evaluates whether two vertices are adjacent, i.e., there exists some edge connecting u and v.
      Parameters:
      u - a vertex
      v - another vertex
      Returns:
      true if they are adjacent, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if u or v are invalid vertices for the graph

    • insertVertex

      Vertex<V> insertVertex(V vElement) throws InvalidVertexException
      Inserts a new vertex with a given element, returning its reference.
      Parameters:
      vElement - the element to store at the vertex
      Returns:
      the reference of the newly created vertex
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if there already exists a vertex containing vElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.

    • insertEdge

      Edge<E,V> insertEdge(Vertex<V> u, Vertex<V> v, E edgeElement) throws InvalidVertexException, InvalidEdgeException
      Inserts a new edge with a given element between two existing vertices and return its (the edge's) reference.
      Parameters:
      u - a vertex
      v - another vertex
      edgeElement - the element to store in the new edge
      Returns:
      the reference for the newly created edge
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if u or v are invalid vertices for the graph
      InvalidEdgeException - if there already exists an edge containing edgeElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.

    • insertEdge

      Edge<E,V> insertEdge(V vElement1, V vElement2, E edgeElement) throws InvalidVertexException, InvalidEdgeException
      Inserts a new edge with a given element between two existing vertices and return its (the edge's) reference.
      Parameters:
      vElement1 - a vertex's stored element
      vElement2 - another vertex's stored element
      edgeElement - the element to store in the new edge
      Returns:
      the reference for the newly created edge
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if vElement1 or vElement2 are not found in any vertices of the graph according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.
      InvalidEdgeException - if there already exists an edge containing edgeElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.

    • removeVertex

      V removeVertex(Vertex<V> v) throws InvalidVertexException
      Removes a vertex, along with all of its incident edges, and returns the element stored at the removed vertex.
      Parameters:
      v - vertex to remove
      Returns:
      element stored at the removed vertex
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if v is an invalid vertex for the graph

    • removeEdge

      E removeEdge(Edge<E,V> e) throws InvalidEdgeException
      Removes an edge and return its element.
      Parameters:
      e - edge to remove
      Returns:
      element stored at the removed edge
      Throws:
      InvalidEdgeException - if e is an invalid edge for the graph.

    • replace

      V replace(Vertex<V> v, V newElement) throws InvalidVertexException
      Replaces the element of a given vertex with a new element and returns the previous element stored at v.
      Parameters:
      v - vertex to replace its element
      newElement - new element to store in v
      Returns:
      previous element previously stored in v
      Throws:
      InvalidVertexException - if the vertex v is invalid for the graph, or; if there already exists another vertex containing the element newElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.

    • replace

      E replace(Edge<E,V> e, E newElement) throws InvalidEdgeException
      Replaces the element of a given edge with a new element and returns the previous element stored at e.
      Parameters:
      e - edge to replace its element
      newElement - new element to store in e
      Returns:
      previous element previously stored in e
      Throws:
      InvalidEdgeException - if the edge e is invalid for the graph, or; if there already exists another edge containing the element newElement according to the equality of Object.equals(java.lang.Object) method.
